title: Shinya Aikawa
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Aikawa was born in <a href="Kamisato%2C%20Saitama">Kamisato, Saitama</a> on July 26, 1983. After graduating from high school, he joined the <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="Hokkaido%20Consadole%20Sapporo">Consadole Sapporo</a> in 2002. On May 6, he debuted against <a href="Vegalta%20Sendai">Vegalta Sendai</a> in the <a href="2002%20J.League%20Cup">J.League Cup</a>. He first played in the J1 League in November and played the last four matches in the <a href="2002%20J.League%20Division%201">2002 season</a>. However Consadole finished in last place and was relegated to the <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> at the end of the 2002 season. He became a regular forward under the new manager <a href="Masaaki%20Yanagishita">Masaaki Yanagishita</a> in 2004 and played often until 2006. However Yanagishita resigned at the end of the 2006 season, and Aikawa did not play as much under the new manager <a href="Toshiya%20Miura">Toshiya Miura</a> in 2007. In September 2007, he moved to the <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> club <a href="FC%20Gifu">FC Gifu</a>. He scored 4 goals in 8 matches and Gifu was promoted to J2 at the end of the <a href="2007%20Japan%20Football%20League">2007 season</a>. However he did not play much in 2008 and retired at the end of the 2008 season.
